alert.note: Alert for Sheridan (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 12 at 10:03AM MDT until June 12 at 5:45PM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: .Melting snow and rain today will continue to push creeks and streams in Sheridan County higher. * WHAT...Flooding caused by rain and snowmelt is expect to occur soon. * WHERE...A portion of north central Wyoming, including the following county, Sheridan. * WHEN...Until 1000 PM MDT Monday. * IMPACTS...Creeks continue to rise due to excess runoff from earlier rainfall. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 958 AM MDT, Emergency management reported high water on upstream creeks in the mountains. This water is expected to push Little Goose Creek, Big Goose Creek and the main Goose Creek to levels which cause low land flooding. - The creeks are expected to exceed levels observed on May 30. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Sheridan. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
